marketing_description: Production Plus streamlines manufacturing operations for promotional product companies by automating work order generation, managing complex imprint and decoration workflows, and tracking production events from sales order through completion. Designed specifically for businesses that customize items with logos, artwork, and branding.
technical_summary: Production Plus extends NetSuite's Work Order Assembly functionality with specialized custom records for managing promotional product manufacturing. The solution creates a Production Plus Record from sales orders containing imprint details, automatically generates and manages work orders, tracks production events with machine assignments, and handles multi-location, multi-design imprinting workflows.

key_features.description: Automatically generates Production Plus Records from sales orders with imprint requirements, consolidating order details, artwork specifications, and production requirements into a centralized manufacturing record.
Captures and tracks complex decoration specifications including artwork items, imprint locations, design variations, color counts, and decoration methods across multiple items and order lines.

Automatically creates, links, and manages work orders based on production requirements. Supports both forward and backward scheduling with routing templates. Handles assembly builds and completion workflows.
Tracks granular production activities with machine assignments, setup time, run time, assigned personnel, and completion status for each manufacturing operation.
Maintains library of stored artwork items and imprint configuration templates. Links artwork files to production events and work orders for consistent decoration across production runs.

Supports forward scheduling (from start date) and backward scheduling (to required date) methodologies. Automatically propagates production dates to linked work orders based on selected scheduling method.
Provides visibility into production status with automated updates to work order states. Tracks total quantities, imprints, designs, and locations across all production events.
Bulk processes multiple work orders for building and completion. Validates inventory availability and routing requirements before executing assembly builds in batch.

deployment_notes: Requires Manufacturing and Work Order features enabled. Dependent on multiple external custom records (SCM, navigation, banking). Extensive configuration of custom lists, routing templates, and imprint templates needed for customer-specific decoration methods. Map/Reduce scripts require adequate governance limits for batch processing.

business_processes.description: Sales order with imprint requirements triggers Production Plus Record creation via Suitelet, consolidating all decoration details and initializing production workflow.

Production Plus Record automatically creates work orders based on sales order line items, assembly requirements, and routing templates. Links work orders to production record for centralized management.
Shop floor personnel create Production Events for each manufacturing operation, recording machine usage, time spent, assigned operators, and artwork utilized.
When inventory and routing requirements are satisfied, work orders are automatically transformed to assembly builds via Map/Reduce script, consuming components and creating finished goods.
Production managers set scheduling method (forward or backward) and dates on Production Plus Record, which automatically propagates to all linked work orders with appropriate start/end dates.
Production managers use Mass Production interfaces to build, complete, or update dates across multiple work orders simultaneously, improving efficiency for high-volume operations.

Artwork usage by item and customer
configuration_requirements: Custom lists populated with machines, designs, locations, colors
Imprint configuration templates created for decoration methods
Routing templates defined for production operations
Item records configured with default imprint templates
Artwork items created and stored in library
Custom forms assigned to appropriate roles
Saved searches configured for Suitelet parameters
scalability_considerations: Map/Reduce scripts handle high-volume batch processing. Custom record structure supports thousands of production records and events. Sublists use saved searches for efficient loading. Consider governance limits for customers processing 100+ work orders simultaneously.
maintenance_requirements: Regular review of custom list values as new machines/designs/methods are added. Periodic cleanup of completed production records. Monitor Map/Reduce script failures and retry. Update saved search filters as business requirements evolve.
licensing_implications: Requires full NetSuite Manufacturing license. Each production user needs appropriate role permissions for custom records. Map/Reduce script consumption counts against account governance limits.
training_requirements: Production managers: 4-8 hours on record creation, scheduling, batch operations
Shop floor operators: 2-4 hours on production event entry and work order management
Sales team: 1-2 hours on imprint detail entry and artwork selection
Art department: 2-3 hours on artwork library and template management
support_model: Custom solution - requires NetSuite developer support for enhancements and troubleshooting. No vendor support available.
upgrade_considerations: Custom solution requires testing with each NetSuite release. Work Order and Assembly Build API changes may impact functionality. Review release notes for changes to WORKORDERS, ASSEMBLIES, and MFGROUTING features.
